etymology.description: semantic: 火 ‘fire’ + 卩 ‘kneeling person’; fire over a person’s head, emphasizing shining of light (Shuowen).
etymology.interpretation: A flame placed above a kneeling figure evokes radiance shining down on someone. The combined imagery naturally extends to the idea of illumination and brightness.

examples.chinese: 早上的阳光很温暖(早上的陽光很溫暖)。
房间里没有光(房間裡沒有光)，我们点了蜡烛(我們點了蠟燭)。
examples.pinyin: Fángjiān lǐ méiyǒu guāng, wǒmen diǎn le làzhú.
examples.english: There was no light in the room, so we lit candles.

examples.chinese: 这盏灯的光很柔和(這盞燈的光很柔和)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǎn dēng de guāng hěn róuhé.
examples.english: The light of this lamp is gentle.
